title: Common definitions used by launch/submission payloads.

account_service_logout_url.description: The base URL of the calling service used to launch EQ.

account_service_url.description: The base URL of the calling service used to launch EQ.

case_id.description: The case UUID, used to identify a single instance of a survey collection for a respondent.

channel.description: The channel used to launch the EQ.

collection_exercise_sid.description: A reference UUID used to represent the collection exercise inside the ONS.

data_version.description: The version number of the questionnaire schemas `data_version`. This indicates the data payload convertor that was used.

display_address.description: The address displayed to the respondent when completing the questionnaire.

flushed.description: Whether the surveyresponse or feedback was flushed or not. This will be `true` if the surveyresponse has been flushed through Runner and `false` otherwise. It is not currently possible for feedback to be flushed.

form_type.description: The particular `form_type` for a responding unit.

jti.description: Set to a random UUID. See RFC 7519 definition of the `jti` claim.

launch_language_code.description: The language code that the questionnaire was launched with.

origin.description: The name or identifier of the data capture system.

payload_version_v2.description: The version number for the payload specification v2 that was used during EQ launch.

period_id.description: A string representing the business area recognised time period for the collection exercise.

region_code.description: A region code defined as per ISO 3166-2:GB

response_expires_at.description: An ISO_8601 formatted date-time after which the unsubmitted partial response can be deleted from the database.

response_id.description: A unique identifier for the questionnaire response.

ru_ref.description: The reporting unit reference with the check letter appended.

schema_url.description: The URL to a schema JSON file that was used for the submitted response.

started_at.description: The datetime of when the first answer was saved in a questionnaire.

submission_language_code.description: The language code that was being used on submission.

submission_type.description: The unique type identifier of this JSON file.

submitted_at.description: The datetime of the submitted survey response or feedback by the respondent.

survey_id.description: The survey identifier as used across the ONS.

user_id.description: The id assigned by the respondent management system.
